intro: Lindernia andringitrae, commonly known as the Andringitra lindernia, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Linderniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
